page.title: 04LANDSCAPE:FLEET WATER
page.content: THE{FLEET WATER }IS A NARROW SALT{ {WATER }LAGOON.IT IS 12 KILOMETRES IN LENGTH.THE WIDEST POINT IS 1 KILOMETRE AND THE NARROWEST POINT IS 125 METRES.IT STARTS AT{ABBOTSBURY}AND ENDS AT{FERRY BRIDGE.}THERE IS A CAUSEWAY GOING ACROSS FROM{LANGTON {HERRING}TO{HERBURY}.IT WAS USED TO TRAP{WATER}SO IT WOULD DRY UP IN THE SUN, THEN PEOPLE WOULD COLLECT POT ASH FROM IT.THERE IS A LOT OF SEAWEED AND EEL GRASS WHICH IS EATEN BY THE SWANS.THE{FLEET}IS MOSTLY SHALLOW WITH LARGE AREAS OF MUD BANKS.IT IS NO GOOD FOR SWIMMING BECAUSE OF THE CURRENT.IT ATTRACTS MANY{FISH} INCLUDING{MULLET,FLOUNDER,BASS}AND{ {EEL.}IT IS GOOD FOR{BIRDS}TOO.THE{ {FLEET}IS WHERE THEY TESTED THE{ {BOUNCING BOMB}IN THE{SECOND WORLD WAR} .
